DOC.brief_title: Efficacy of Pulsatile GnRH Therapy on Male Patients With Pituitary Stalk Interruption Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: To investigate the hormone response of hypothalamic-pituitary-gonad axis and spermatogenesis in male pituitary stalk interruption syndrome patients by pulsatile GnRH therapy. The hormonal response of the hypothalamic-pituitary-gonad axis was assessed after pulsatile GnRH replacement by measurement of serum T, LH and FSH. A standard seminal fluid analysis was performed in men who could produce an ejaculate.
DOC.criteria: 18 years or over male patients; Absent or incomplete puberty development; Serum testosterone values below 3.47 nmol/L by low or normal serum LH and FSH concentrations. at least two or more pituitary hormone deficiencies Brain MRI showed absent and thin pituitary stalk, or pituitary hypoplasia and/or ectopic posterior pituitary. cryptorchidism history other causes of hypopituitarism or severe systemic disease
